VALID_FILENAME_CHARS

public static final com.google.common.base.CharMatcher VALID_FILENAME_CHARS
A CharMatcher that matches valid filename characters: [0-9],[a-z],[A-Z],'_','.', and '-'

Returns the given string enclosed with quotation marks.

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:

public static String unquote(String str)
Returns the given quoted string without quotation marks.

Parameters:
str - quoted string
Returns:
string without quotation marks
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if str doesn't have a leading or a trailing quotation mark
NullPointerException - if str is null

replaceLastOccurrence

public static String replaceLastOccurrence(String string,
                                           String target,
                                           String replacement)
Returns a new String resulting from replacing the last occurrence of target in string with replacement. If target does not occur in string, string is returned.

Parameters:
string - the original string
target - the value to be replaced
replacement - the replacement value
Returns:
the resulting string

createProjectName

public static String createProjectName(Set<String> existingProjectNames)
Autogenerates a projectname and verifies it does not already exist in existingProjectNames

normalizeForFilename

public static String normalizeForFilename(String str)
Create a name safe for use in file paths from the provided String str. It is fairly conservative to attempt, not guarantee, maximum compatability for most operating systems.
